Major_Arcs.title: Circus Arrival and Initial Chaos
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Paul Bunyan and the circus setting, quickly escalating into conflict as Matto Grasso's disruptive schemes unfold, leading to initial confrontations and Paul Bunyan's intervention.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Introduction and Public Arrival
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Paul Bunyan's circus act and the general public's excited arrival at the circus, setting the initial lighthearted tone before conflicts arise.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Circus and Giraffe Encounter

sub_scenes.title: Tent Intrigue and Matto Grasso's First Assault
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts the tone dramatically, as a man investigates suspicious sounds, leading to confrontations with Billings and then Matto Grasso, initiating the story's central conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Investigating Sounds of Trouble and Encountering Billings
Confrontation and Attack by Matto Grasso
Overpowering Matto Grasso and Immediate Aftermath

Major_Arcs.title: Recruitment and Revenge Plot
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the circus owner's recruitment of Paul Bunyan as the new strongman, which ignites Matto Grasso's vengeful plot, culminating in an arson attempt and Paul Bunyan's heroic response.

sub_scenes.title: Owner's Predicament and Bunyan's Recruitment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the circus owner's encounter with Matto Grasso (disguised as the strongman) and the subsequent recruitment of Paul Bunyan as the new circus strongman, setting the stage for Grasso's revenge.

narrative_arcs.title: Owner's Exposition on Matto Grasso's Threats
Introduction of Paul Bunyan and Matto Grasso's Revenge Plot

sub_scenes.title: Arson and Heroic Intervention
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Matto Grasso enacting his revenge by attempting to burn down the circus, followed by Paul Bunyan's quick and effective action to extinguish the fire, showcasing his heroic nature.

narrative_arcs.title: The Fire and Paul Bunyan's Resolution

Major_Arcs.title: Ape Sabotage and Chase in the Arena
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Matto Grasso's second attempt at sabotage by releasing an ape, leading to a chaotic chase through the circus arena with Paul Bunyan in pursuit, culminating in Grasso's capture.

sub_scenes.title: Ape Release and Initial Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Matto Grasso's continued frustration and his new plan to release an ape, followed by the ape's escape and Paul Bunyan initiating the chase.

narrative_arcs.title: Matto Grasso's Lingering Frustration and New Scheme
The Ape's Release and Paul Bunyan's Intervention
The Chase Begins: Paul Bunyan Pursues Matto Grasso

sub_scenes.title: Arena Chase and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the chase entering the circus arena, with Matto Grasso attempting to evade Paul Bunyan amidst the audience, leading to comical obstacles and eventual capture.

Major_Arcs.title: Bunyan's Farewell and Marco Polo's Eastern Tale Begins
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes Paul Bunyan's circus story with his polite rejection of a job offer and farewell, before transitioning to a new narrative featuring Marco Polo and his adventures in Tibet.

sub_scenes.title: Job Rejection and Circus Farewell
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene wraps up Paul Bunyan's circus adventure with his polite refusal of a permanent job offer and his departure, bringing closure to his arc in this setting.

sub_scenes.title: Marco Polo's Tibetan Adventure Begins
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Marco Polo and his perilous journey to Tibet, setting up a new adventure with a mysterious and dangerous tone, distinct from the circus narrative.

Major_Arcs.title: The Talking Head and Rescue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc presents a bizarre encounter with a severed talking head in a forest, leading to Marco Polo's act of kindness and the beginning of a reciprocal relationship.

sub_scenes.title: Discovery and Plea of the Severed Head
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the shocking discovery of a severed head by a man on horseback, which turns out to be alive and pleading for help, creating a strange and urgent situation.

sub_scenes.title: Rescue and Debt Repayment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Marco Polo rescuing a bound man who then offers repayment for saving his life, initiating an exchange of gratitude and a sacred dagger.

Major_Arcs.title: Mourning in Hi-Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Marco Polo's arrival at Hi-Town, where initial misinterpretations of the city's atmosphere lead to the discovery of a kingdom in mourning over a missing princess, setting up a new quest for Marco Polo.

sub_scenes.title: Arrival and Misunderstanding of Hi-Town
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Marco Polo and his companion arriving at Hi-Town and initially mistaking the somber atmosphere for a celebration, highlighting their outsider perspective.

sub_scenes.title: The King's Plea and Marco's Offer
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Marco Polo to the King, who reveals the cause of mourning – the missing Princess Lotus – prompting Marco Polo to offer his assistance, starting a new rescue mission.

narrative_arcs.title: Meeting the King and the Missing Princess

Major_Arcs.title: The Witch's Castle Deception
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Marco Polo's detour to help a beggar woman, leading him to a mysterious castle that turns out to be a trap set by a monstrous ogress, revealing a deceitful encounter.

sub_scenes.title: Diversion by the Beggar Woman
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a beggar woman who intercepts Marco Polo and the King with a plea for help, diverting Marco Polo from his initial quest and leading him into a new, unexpected direction.

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's Castle and Deception Revealed
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene exposes the beggar woman's true identity as an ogress in a castle, revealing her sinister deception and trapping Marco Polo in a dangerous situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Mysterious Castle and Revealing the 'Children'
Transformation and Confrontation with the Ogress
Impending Battle with Mice and Claws

Major_Arcs.title: Ogress Defeat and Princess Rescue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the capture of Princess Lotus by the Ogress, but shifts to a new young man's story, intertwined with the princess. He is also captured by the Ogress but manages to defeat her using a magic knife, rescuing the princess.

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's Capture of a Young Man and Princess
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts focus to a young man's encounter with the Ogress, leading to his capture and restraint, paralleling Princess Lotus's capture and setting up a joint predicament.

narrative_arcs.title: Attack, Escape Attempt and Capture by Snakes
Further Restraint and Threat of Revenge

sub_scenes.title: Knife of Hope and Ogress's Downfall
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene showcases the young man's discovery of a magic knife and his courageous decision to use it, despite skepticism, leading to a surprise attack and the Ogress's defeat, freeing both captives.

narrative_arcs.title: The Surprise Attack and Ogress's Defeat

Major_Arcs.title: Royal Reunion and Marco's Departure
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes Marco Polo's (revealed to be the young man) adventure in Hi-Town with the rescue of Princess Lotus, a royal reunion, and Marco's polite refusal of marriage, choosing to continue his adventures.

sub_scenes.title: Return to Hi-Town and Cultural Misunderstanding
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Marco Polo and the Princess returning to Hi-Town, where they encounter a cultural misunderstanding regarding mourning drapes, adding a lighthearted touch before the royal reunion.

sub_scenes.title: Royal Welcome and Declined Marriage Offer
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes Marco Polo's arc with a joyful reunion with the King, a marriage proposal as a reward, and Marco's polite but firm refusal, reaffirming his adventurous spirit.

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra and Captain's Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc begins a new story, narrated by the Treasure Keeper, about a British penal colony and a prisoner's tale of hidden treasure, leading to betrayal and a long-sought revenge.

sub_scenes.title: Prologue by the Treasure Keeper and Penal Colony Setting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the Treasure Keeper as a narrator and establishes the new setting of a British penal colony in the tropics, setting a tone of mystery and impending conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Prisoner's Bargain and Captain's Deception
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details a prisoner urgently seeking a private conversation with the Captain, revealing a tale of buried treasure in exchange for escape, leading to a deceptive agreement.

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal, Imprisonment, and Vow of Revenge
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the Captain's betrayal, Officer Jordan's imprisonment and despair, and his long-term vow of revenge, setting up a quest for retribution years later.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Betrayal and Captain's Escape

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation and Fatal Betrayal in the Attic
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Jordan's pursuit of the Captain to England, leading to a tense confrontation at the Captain's home that culminates in a violent betrayal and a desperate attempt to escape justice.

sub_scenes.title: The Vigil and Deceptive Agreement
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Jordan's patient vigil for the Captain and their eventual confrontation, where the Captain feigns agreement and lures Jordan into a trap at his home.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Brooking's Home: A Luxurious Trap
Ascent to the Attic and Treasure Reveal

sub_scenes.title: Attic Assault and Captain's Downfall
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the Captain's true colors as he betrays and attacks Jordan in the attic, leading to a violent struggle and ultimately the Captain's attempt to escape police intervention after shooting Jordan.

sub_scenes.title: Narrator's Moral Epilogue
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the treasure story with the Treasure Keeper delivering a moral message about the corrupting influence of money, providing a thematic closure.

Major_Arcs.title: Dr. Styx and the Haunted Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Dr. Styx and Henry Northrup, shifting to a supernatural mystery involving a haunted estate linked to a murder, setting up a new investigation into paranormal activities.

sub_scenes.title: Dr. Styx's Mysterious Encounter and Courtroom Drama
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Dr. Styx in a peculiar encounter and then shifts to a courtroom scene involving a murder trial and sentencing, setting a dramatic and mysterious tone.

sub_scenes.title: Northrup Investigates the Haunted Estate
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Henry Northrup and his expertise in supernatural events, as he is called upon to investigate the troubled Matthews estate, setting up a ghost story investigation.

narrative_arcs.title: The White Elephant Estate and Unsavory Events
Arrival at the Haunted Matthews Estate
Ignoring the Warning and Entering the Haunted House

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Vincent Matthews' Ghost
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Henry Northrup entering the haunted house and immediately encountering the ominous voice and then ghostly figure of Vincent Matthews, initiating a direct supernatural confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: The Sinister Voice of Vincent Matthews

Major_Arcs.title: Overcoming Fear and Seeking Redemption
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows the physical and philosophical confrontation between Northrup (Man in Brown) and the ghost, leading to the ghost's vulnerability and the quest for redemption through forgiveness and love.

sub_scenes.title: Physical and Philosophical Battle with the Ghost
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the initial physical attack by the ghost, followed by a struggle where Northrup surprisingly overpowers the ghost, leading to a philosophical discourse on violence and fear.

narrative_arcs.title: Admission of Fear and Seeking Salvation

sub_scenes.title: Rosalind's Forgiveness and Brotherly Love
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Northrup revealing the path to the ghost's salvation - forgiveness from his murdered sister Rosalind - leading to her summoning, forgiveness, and expression of brotherly love, freeing the ghost.

narrative_arcs.title: The Condition for Rest and the Forgiver's Identity
Resistance and Compulsion to Confront Rosalind
Identification and Introduction of the Accused

sub_scenes.title: Resolution of the Haunted House Mystery
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the haunted house narrative with Northrup reassuring the older man that the spirit is at peace and offering to take him to town, resolving the immediate ghost story.

narrative_arcs.title: The Troubled House and the Drive to Town

Major_Arcs.title: The Voyages of Henry Hudson and Mutiny
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a historical narrative about Henry Hudson's voyages to find the Northwest Passage, detailing his initial acceptance of the mission, the hardships faced, and the tragic mutiny that resulted in his banishment.

sub_scenes.title: Historical Prologue and Dutch East India Company's Offer
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets the historical context of Henry Hudson's ill-fated voyage and introduces the Dutch East India Company's proposition for him to find the Northwest Passage.

narrative_arcs.title: Historical Context of Henry Hudson's Fate
The Dutch East India Company's Proposition

sub_scenes.title: Unfruitful Voyage and Growing Discontent
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the initial voyage, the crew's growing frustration and dwindling hope as they fail to find the passage, leading to a suggestion of mutiny.

narrative_arcs.title: Threat of Mutiny and Turning South
Entering the Hudson River with Hope
False Alarm and Realization of Dead End
Hudson's Reflection and Decision to Return Home

sub_scenes.title: Second Voyage and Tragic Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Hudson's second voyage, his crew's increasing desperation as they get trapped in ice, leading to a full-scale mutiny and Hudson's banishment and tragic fate.

narrative_arcs.title: Extreme Northerly Route and Icy Predicament
The Ice Melts and Voyage Recommences
Mutiny and Captain's Assertion of Authority
Return of the Mutineers and Grim News

Major_Arcs.title: The Arabian Knight and the Tartar Threat
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Hassan, the Arabian Knight, and his mission to rescue a kidnapped girl from the Tartar horsemen led by Kurgan, starting a new adventure in a desert setting.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Hassan and the Tartar Crisis
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Hassan and the threat posed by Kurgan's Tartars, setting up a damsel in distress scenario and Hassan's heroic role.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of the Arabian Knight and the Tartar Threat
Summoned by the Caliph and the Rescue Mission

sub_scenes.title: Hassan's Journey and Encounter with Traveler
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene follows Hassan's journey to find the Tartars, his arrival at the oasis, and his encounter with another traveler who shares his mission, reinforcing his resolve.

narrative_arcs.title: Journey to the Oasis and Discovery of Tracks
Following the Trail of the Tartars
Encounter and Warning from a Traveler

Major_Arcs.title: Infiltration, Rescue, and Trial by Combat
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Hassan's infiltration of the Tartar camp, his discovery and contact with the captive girl, leading to his capture and acceptance of Kurgan's challenge of trial by combat for her freedom.

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Discovery of the Captive
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Hassan's stealthy approach to the Tartar camp, subduing a sentry, disguising himself, and infiltrating the camp, eventually locating and contacting the captive girl.

narrative_arcs.title: Inside the Tartar Camp - The Search Begins
Reaching the Prisoner and Making Contact

sub_scenes.title: Capture and Kurgan's Challenge
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Hassan's discovery by Tartar guards, his capture, and his subsequent interrogation by Kurgan, leading to the challenge of trial by combat.

Major_Arcs.title: Unarmed Victory and Romantic Reward
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes Hassan's adventure with his unlikely victory in the trial by combat using only dirt and wits, leading to Kurgan honoring his word, the girl's rescue, and a budding romance between Hassan and the rescued woman.

sub_scenes.title: Unarmed Combat and Improbable Triumph
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the unfair fight where Hassan, unarmed, cleverly uses dirt to blind and defeat Kurgan's warriors one by one, showcasing his ingenuity and fighting skills.

narrative_arcs.title: The Signal and the Unfair Fight Begins
Dirt in the Eyes and Immediate Attack

sub_scenes.title: Farewell, Gratitude, and Romantic Spark
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes Hassan's story with Kurgan honoring his agreement and letting them go, followed by the woman's heartfelt gratitude and a developing romantic connection with Hassan, marked by a farewell kiss.
